member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.EnableMPLogging
member.summary: Enable the multiprocessor logging style even when running in non-multiprocessor mode. This logging style is on by default.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.DisableMPLogging
member.summary: Disable the multiprocessor logging style of output when running in non-multiprocessor mode.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.ForceConsoleColor
member.summary: Undocumented switch to force ansi colors.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.DisableConsoleColor
member.summary: Use the default console colors for all logging messages.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.ForceNoAlign
member.summary: Don't align the text to the size of the console buffer.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.ShowEventId
member.summary: Show the event ID for each started event, finished event, and message.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.ShowTimestamp
member.summary: Show the timestamp as a prefix to any message.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.ShowCommandLine
member.summary: Show `TaskCommandLineEvent` messages.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.NoItemAndPropertyList
member.summary: Don't show the list of items and properties that would appear at the start of each project build if the verbosity level is set to `diagnostic`.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.WarningsOnly
member.summary: Show only warnings.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.ErrorsOnly
member.summary: Show only errors.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.NoSummary
member.summary: Don't show the error and warning summary at the end.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.Summary
member.summary: Show the error and warning summary at the end.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.PerformanceSummary
member.summary: Show the time thatâ€™s spent in tasks, targets, and projects.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildLogParameter.Append
member.summary: Determines whether the build log is appended to the log file or overwrites it. When you set the switch, the build log is appended to the log file. When the switch is not present, the contents of an existing log file are overwritten. If you include the append switch, no matter whether it is set to true or false, the log is appended. If you do not include the append switch, the log is overwritten.

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.MSBuild.runReleaseExt(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Fake.DotNet.MSBuildParams,Fake.DotNet.MSBuildParams},System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Tuple{System.String,System.String}},System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Builds the given project files or solution files in release mode and collects the output files. ## Parameters - `setParams` - A function that overwrites the default MSBuildParams - `outputPath` - If it is null or empty then the project settings are used. - `properties` - A list with tuples of property name and property values. - `targets` - A string with the target names which should be run by MSBuild. - `projects` - A list of project or solution files.

member.summary: Builds the given project files or solution files in release mode to the default outputs. ## Parameters - `targets` - A string with the target names which should be run by MSBuild. - `projects` - A list of project or solution files.

Builds the given project files and collects the output files. ## Parameters - `setParams` - A function that overwrites the default MSBuildParams - `outputPath` - If it is null or empty then the project settings are used. - `targets` - A string with the target names which should be run by MSBuild. - `properties` - A list with tuples of property name and property values. - `projects` - A list of project or solution files.

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.MSBuild.build(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Fake.DotNet.MSBuildParams,Fake.DotNet.MSBuildParams},System.String)
member.summary:
Runs a MSBuild project ## Parameters - `setParams` - A function that overwrites the default MSBuildParams - `project` - A string with the path to the project file to build.
## Sample
open Fake.DotNet let buildMode = Environment.environVarOrDefault "buildMode" "Release" let setParams (defaults:MSBuildParams) = { defaults with Verbosity = Some(Quiet) Targets = ["Build"] Properties = [ "Optimize", "True" "DebugSymbols", "True" "Configuration", buildMode ] } MSBuild.build setParams "./MySolution.sln"

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildExe.msBuildExe
member.summary:
Tries to detect the right version of MSBuild.
- On all OS's, we check a `MSBuild` environment variable which is either * a direct path to a file to use, or * a directory that contains a file called * `msbuild` on non-Windows systems with mono >= 5.0.0.0, or * `xbuild` on non-Windows systems with mono < 5.0.0.0, * `MSBuild.exe` on Windows systems, or * a tool that exists on the current PATH - In addition, on non-Windows systems we check the current PATH for the following binaries, in this order: * Mono >= 5.0.0.0: `msbuild`, `xbuild` * Mono < 5.0.0.0: `xbuild`, `msbuild` * This is due to several known issues in the Mono < 5.0 implementation of MSBuild. - In addition, on Windows systems we * try to read the MSBuild tool location from the AppSettings file using a parameter named `MSBuild`, and finally * if a `VisualStudioVersion` environment variable is specified, we try to use the specific MSBuild version, matching that Visual Studio version.

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.MSBuildExe.monoVersionToUseMSBuildOn
member.summary: Versions of Mono prior to this one have faulty implementations of MSBuild NOTE: in System.Version 5.0 >= 5.0.0.0 is false while 5.0.0.0 >= 5.0 is true...
